column4: ubuntu kind of made a mess of the runlevel stuff. What are you trying to do exactly?
I have my NIC cards configured in /etc/network/interfaces , but nothing loads it on boot ... also did a iptables.rules on /etc but cant get it loaded
and want to echo 1 > /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_forward
which version OS and what runlevel are you at?
ubuntu 9.04 Runlevel 2
the echo 1 > /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_forward is probably easiest done by putting it into /etc/rc.local
ok.. already there now

re: the nic stuff, are you sure nothing loads it. A syntax error in your interfaces file will make it look like it's not loading. What happens when you run sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart by hand?
iptables-restore < /etc/iptables.rules        there too or is there a "beautifull" way?
nothing happens.. leme check again
running it from rc.local is beautiful enough for me...
my eth0 just do not goes up
well, if it doesn't work by hand, it certainly won't work at boot time. Any relevant-looking error messages in /var/log ?
got it.. it was my mistake all the time...
I was missing auto eth0 on interfaces file
cool...
thanks for your help ;)
a pleasure
anyway.. if I want to check what services are starting at boot, so I can disable unused ones..
isn't it possible from command line?
basically I think everything in runlevel 2 is started from /etc/rc2.d...
how about that update-rc.d ? does it plays with this symlinks?
sorry, my attention wandered. Yes, update-rc.d changes the symlinks. You used to have to set them by hand. Check the man page
well.. thanks again ;)
